sentence: Technology stocks were hanging on to small gains this afternoon, with shares of technology companies in the S&P 500 climbing about 0.2%.
In company news, ReneSola Ltd. ( SOL ) surged Monday after the solar panel manufacturer today said it sold a 300-kilowatt low-voltage project to a local firm in Kyoto, Japan.

RenaSola said the new project was representative of its long-term strategy to build a portfolio of relatively small-sized ground or commercial rooftops panel arrays that can be then sold to either retail or institutional investors.
The company also said it has closed on the sale and received all proceeds from the project without disclosing any of the financial terms.
SOL shares were up nearly 8% this afternoon at $1.03 each, easing from an earlier run to $1.08 a share.
The stock had previously fallen more than 69% over the past year before Monday's rally.

(+) PLUG, (+17.3%) Seeking Alpha article speculates company could increase revenue by $1 bln if it can convert 100 distribution facilities to hydrogen power following Friday's opening of a distribution center at a Home Depot ( HD ) store.
(-) AFFX, (-5.6%) Selected to be the genotyping supplier for the Green Super Rice project by the Chinese Academy of Agricultural Sciences.
